bullets.text: Europe asserts role in Ukraine talks as Trump sidelines allies; France launches voluntary military service; Putin signals openness to serious negotiations.
China industrial profits fell 5.5% in October, signaling manufacturing weakness; hotter Tokyo inflation complicates BOJ policy; Asia stocks trade mixed.
Puma shares jumped ~18% on report China's Anta may bid, highlighting renewed Chinese outbound M&A appetite in global sportswear.
Apple appeals India’s potential $38 billion antitrust penalty, escalating Big Tech-regulator tensions in a crucial growth market.
SEC reportedly probes Jefferies over First Brands collapse, spotlighting risk controls and disclosure practices across leveraged credit.
Investors signal rotation from crowded AI trade amid rising capex burdens and margin risks; some bet against Nvidia while ETFs pivot toward broader value.
Google’s TPU-centric strategy, tight hardware-software integration, and cost advantages underpin its AI comeback narrative versus GPU-heavy rivals.
Canada eases climate rules to fast-track an Alberta oil pipeline, prioritizing energy security and investment over environmental safeguards.
Finland’s 250MWh sand battery project advances long-duration thermal storage for district heating and grid ancillary services, diversifying clean energy storage options.
Gene therapy now effectively cures most infants with SCID (bubble boy disease), marking a pivotal advance in pediatric precision medicine.
Studies find avian influenza strains resistant to fever, increasing zoonotic risk and complicating human pandemic preparedness.
Two-decade study links cleaner water to substantial reductions in cancer and cardiovascular mortality, underscoring public infrastructure’s health dividend.
Breakthroughs in PFAS degradation and Teflon recycling suggest scalable routes to tackle forever chemicals, with major environmental and liability implications.
Hong Kong’s deadliest fire in decades exposes building safety lapses; Chinese firms pledge aid, while scrutiny turns to enforcement and infrastructure standards.
SNAP eased holiday food insecurity as consumers face relentless price pressure; Black Friday deal-hunting intensifies but risks higher household debt.
